div.p: 60/1509, unit 6, pp. 709-10, VPRS 7935/P1, outward letterbooks to the general public, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In reply to your letter of the 5th Instant,
M’s letter has not been found, but it is recorded in the registers of the Department of Lands and Survey; see no. 7585, roll 4, VPRS 227/P1 inward correspondence register, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria, where its receipt is registered, and A22, roll 1, VPRS 226/P1 index to inward correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria,, where the content is summarized: ‘Solicits data available for ascertaining the temperature of the rivers of Victoria’. I have the honor to state for the information of the Committee of the Zoological Gardens that there are no data in this Office relating to the temperature of the various rivers of the Colony, and the Officers of the Department are too much occupied in the extension of the survey of the Colony to be able to devote the necessary time to the carrying out of such a comprehensive series of observations as would afford definite information on the subject.
Settlers, whose homesteads are situated on or near the banks of rivers might probably be willing to assist your Committee, if supplied with thermometers.

If, however, an observation taken on any appointed day would be of use, thus much might be done by this Department towards the object, while it is unable to undertake a series of observations throughout the year.
